curam.util.common.path

Class DataAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.path.DataAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PathResolver

    public class DataAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements PathResolver
    A data accessor that wraps a collection of path resolver containers with their configured plug-ins and implements the PathResolver interface to provide access to data. The class also adds some convenience methods for use when a path needs to be constructed from strings.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(Path path)
                     throws DataAccessException
        Gets the formatted string value of the data identified by the path. The data will be formatted with respect to the active locale and time zone. If the path represents a list, a list index must be applied or an exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        get in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The formatted string value of the data (may be null).
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the path is invalid or a required value cannot be retrieved.

      • getGeneric

        public java.lang.String getGeneric(Path path)
                            throws DataAccessException
        Gets the generically formatted string representation of the data identified by the path. The retrieved data will be independent from the user locale, so that the same path in any locale will always return the same generic data.
        Specified by:
        getGeneric in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The generic value of the data (may be null).
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the path is invalid or a required value cannot be retrieved.

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
                     throws DataAccessException
        Gets the formatted string value of the data identified by the path strings. One or more path strings can be supplied and they will be concatenated to form a single path, the concatenation treats separate strings as separate paths with separate steps, so "/a" and "b" form the path "/a/b" and not "/ab". Therefore, path separators need not be specified, which makes this method more convenient.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The formatted string value of the data.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the value cannot be retrieved.

      • getGeneric

        public java.lang.String getGeneric(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
                            throws DataAccessException
        Gets the generic formatted string value of the data identified by the path strings. See DataAccessor.get(String[]) for details on the path strings.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The generic formatted string value of the data.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the value cannot be retrieved.

      • getList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(Path path)
                                         throws DataAccessException

        Gets a list of the formatted string values of the data identified by the path. The data will be formatted with respect to the active locale and time zone. If the path does not represent a list (or represents a single, indexed value from a list), an exception will be thrown.

        If only the size of the list is of interest, use the PathResolver.count(Path) method instead, as it may be more efficient.

        Specified by:
        getList in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The list of formatted string values of the data. The list may be empty, but will never be null, though entries may be null. The list is not modifiable.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the path is invalid or a required values cannot be retrieved.

      • getList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
                                         throws DataAccessException
        Gets the list of formatted string values of the data identified by the path strings. See DataAccessor.get(String[]) for details on the path strings and DataAccessor.getList(Path) for more details on the returned list.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The list of formatted string values of the data.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the values cannot be retrieved.

        Parameters:

      • getSortOrder

        public int getSortOrder(Path path)
                 throws DataAccessException

        Gets the sort order of a value identified by the path. If no sort order is defined for that value, -1 is returned.

        Specified by:
        getSortOrder in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the value for which a sort order is to be returned.
        Returns:
        The sort order of the value. If no sort order is specified, -1 is returned.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the data cannot be accessed.

      • getSortOrder

        public int getSortOrder(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
                 throws DataAccessException
        Gets the sort order of of the data identified by the path strings. See DataAccessor.get(String[]) for details on the path strings and DataAccessor.getSortOrder(Path) for more details on the returned list.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The sort order of the value. If no sort order is specified, -1 is returned
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the sort order cannot be retrieved.

      • count

        public int count(Path path)
          throws DataAccessException

        Gets the count of the values identified by the path. This may be more efficient than getting a list of values and then getting the size of the list if the list would not otherwise be used. The count will always be the same as the size of the list retrieved for the same path. Generally, where the PathResolver.getList(Path) method would throw an exception, this method will also throw an exception, for example, if the path does not resolve to a list.

        When iterating over the elements in a list, do not use this method in the loop condition to control the number of iterations, as it may be very inefficient to call it repeatedly. Instead, get the list of values and get the size from the list using java.util.List.size() or use the list iterator.

        Specified by:
        count in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The number of values identified by the path.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the count cannot be calculated.

      • count

        public int count(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
          throws DataAccessException
        Gets the count of the values identified by the path strings. Some paths resolve to single values and others to lists of values, so the count of the values may be more than one if the path identifies a list. See DataAccessor.get(String[]) for information on how the path strings are used to construct a path.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be resolved.
        Returns:
        The number of values identified by the path.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the count cannot be calculated.

      • execute

        public void execute(Path path)
             throws DataAccessException
        Executes the action described by the path. While most paths describe a reference to data, some describe an action that can be performed. For path resolvers that do not describe actions, an exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface PathResolver
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be executed.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the path is not executable, or if there is a problem during execution.

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String... pathStrings)
             throws DataAccessException
        Executes the action described by the path strings. See DataAccessor.get(String[]) for information on how the path strings are used to construct a path.
        Parameters:
        pathStrings - The path strings representing the path to be executed.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If the path is not executable, or if there is a problem during execution.
